decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun within 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To prevent the accumulation of unimplemented planning permissions and to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and to meet the requirements of Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 and to meet the requirements of The Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015.
Condition : 2 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the reports, specifications and drawings detailed TECHNICAL REPORT NO. R-9060-DJC-RGM (DATED 28TH MAY 2021); 2104/P/106; 2104/P/107; 2104/P/100 A. 
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of development and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme. 
Condition : 3 - The use hereby permitted shall not be open to customers other than between the hours of:
(a) 0500 to 2100hrs Mondays - Saturdays
(b) 0600 to 2000hrs Sundays and Bank Holidays 
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood, in accordance with Council policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.
Condition : 4 - Prior to the first occupation of the development, the refuse and recycling storage shown on approved drawings shall be provided and shall be retained for the users of the development and for no other purpose.
Reason: To ensure adequate provision is made for waste storage in accordance with Council policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.
Condition : 5 - Prior to the commencement of the fitness centre use hereby permitted, details of an insulation scheme within the commercial unit to protect the amenity of 
residential occupiers within the upper floors of the building against the 
transmission of airborne sound and impact sound between the ground and first floor levels shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority, and the approved scheme shall be implemented prior to the first to the commencement of the fitness centre hereby approved. 
For the avoidance of doubt, details of a noise impact assessment in respect of the ground floor plant room and the necessary mitigation measures shall also be submitted in pursuance of this condition.  
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of residential occupiers, in accordance 
with Council policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.
Condition : 6 - Prior to commencement of the fitness centre use hereby permitted, a Noise Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The management plan shall include details how noise and vibrations generated by the gym use are to be managed to prevent disturbance to residential occupiers in the upper floors of the building. The operations shall be undertaken in accordance with the approved plan. 
Reason: To protect neighbouring residents from noise and nuisance, on an on-going basis, in accordance with DMPD policy DMS1. It is necessary for the condition to be discharged prior to the commencement of the gym use on site to ensure acceptable mechanisms, operations and measures are in place to minimise the effects of noise where possible so as to avoid unacceptable noise levels and disturbance to neighbouring occupiers.
Condition : 7 - Prior to commencement of above ground works (excluding demolition), details of the location, number and design of secure and covered cycle parking shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  The cycle parking shall be provided in accordance with the approved details prior to the occupation of the development and be retained for cycle parking purposes for the users of the development and for no other purpose.
Reason: To ensure adequate provision is made for cycle parking in accordance with Council policy DMT2 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.
Condition : 8 - Prior to the commencement of the use of the commercial unit as a fitness centre, details of biodiversity enhancement measures including the installation of bird and bat boxes shall be submitted to an approved in writing by the local planning authority.  The approved measures shall be implemented prior to the commencement of the use hereby approved.  
Reason:  To compensate for noncompliance with BREEAM measures in accordance with policy DMS3 of the Councils adopted Development Management Policies Document (2016). 
Condition : 9 - INFORMATIVE: In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application.  The Council has made available detailed advice in the form of its statutory policies in the Local Plan consisting of the Core Strategy, Development Management Policies Document, Supplementary Planning Documents and where appropriate the Site Specific Allocations Document as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition, where appropriate, further guidance was offered to the applicant during the processing of the application.
subdivision_of_building: Ground Floor, Commercial Unit - The applicant wishes to make amendments to the approved shopfront elevations to allow for minor alterations to the shopfront. Involving the removal of a wall and 2 shopfront doors to accommodate one commercial unit on grounds of cost, providing a more functional and feasible shopfront. New addition of louver panel to facilitate ventilation into plant room and other negligible amendments to the glazing.
description: Alterations including installation of new shopfront and provision of refuse storage in connection with change of use of ground floor from Retail (Class E) to Fitness Studio (Class E); submission of details secured by conditions 5 (BREEAM), condition 9 (refuse store) and condition 12 (noise insulation) of planning permission 2017/0488 dated 22/06/2017.
